dialogues.text: Now, do you really think I’m gonna let you walk out of here with ten big ones... of my money? Cameron whips out a PEARL HANDLED PISTOL, aims, but Billy ready: He fires his - Edward’s - gun at Cameron from underneath the table. Cameron dives into the darkness of living room. Looking for his pistol, Cameron glimpses at hip: Blood. Plenty of it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucker...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NILES MANSION, NIGHT
dialogues.text: The patrol car, headlights off, slowly approaches the Nil house. Sheriff Robert spots Cameron's 4x4 and draws his pistol. Earl alongside, the Sheriff marches towards the porch. Earl notices the open barn-door, motions to his bo

dialogues.speaker: INT. BARN, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Sheriff Robert and Earl enter. The Sheriff turns on the overhead light. Earl peeks inside the CADILLAC: Nothing. CU: EARL’S BOOTS, as he steps into a puddle of blood. Ear looks down, remains calm. Sheriff Robert and Earl exchang looks, move toward the trunk. Traces of blood cover the h Earl steps aside and reaches inside the car. CU: TRUNK CADILLAC. The hood pops open. Sheriff Robert an Earl stare at a body wrapped up in bloody sheets. Earl pu out a switchblade knife and starts cutting along the wire pulls back a piece of the cloth to reveal: CU: EDWARD'S BLOODY HEAD. A gruesome sight.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: God all mighty. Both turn as they hear GUN SHOTS coming from the main building. CU: EDWARD'S BLOODY HEAD. His eyes are twitching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy moves in for the kill, but Cameron manages to get a hold of his pistol and shoots. Billy is hit in the leg. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  96. He dives underneath the dining-room table and keeps shoot away with Cameron “answering”. Windows shatter. A picture Ellen and Uncle Niles is riddled with bullets, crashes to floor. Another round grazes Billy’s arm. Billy drops the pistol as he dives toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Billy hits the linoleum floor. Silence follows.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Sarah slowly moves down the main staircase. She spots Bil gun, carefully picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: DINING-ROOM
dialogues.text: Cameron reloads his pistol, then watchfully rises from be an easy-chair and disappears into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: CU: Billy, breathing hard, crawls backwards looking about kitchen. Nobody in sight. He checks his pocket making sur that the envelope containing the money didn’t get lost.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NILES MANSION, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Sheriff Robert tiptoes alongside the mansion, his gun dra

dialogues.speaker: INT. NILES MANSION, NIGHT
dialogues.text: We hear the SOUND of a gun being cocked. Billy turns, gaz down the barrel of Cameron’s pistol.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Checkmate. Game’s over. Suddenly, another SOUND of a gun being cocked. Cameron tu Sarah is aiming at Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Silly me. I forgot all about you. Dragging his right leg, Cameron limps toward Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will pull the trigger. Sarah pulls the trigger. The gun fires nicking Cameron’s Cameron keeps moving, swatting the blood from his ear.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You little junkie whore... She pulls the trigger again CLICK. CLICK, CLICK. Nothing. Cameron smiles. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  97. He grabs Sarah by her hair, throws her hard onto the floo Billy and Sarah huddle up to one another. Cameron points. CAMERON (CONT’D) Who wants to go first? CU: SHERIFF ROBERT, as he steps onto the scene, targeting Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: Hold it right there... Cameron swiftly turns, aims his gun at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Bob? Jesus Christ, what the hell do you think they’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: I’m here to arrest these two for criminal fraud, trespassing, identity theft and a dozen other things...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Then how come you’re pointing your pistol at me?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: Looks like you’re gonna have some questions to answer yourself. Put the gun down Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Robert, just turn around, walk away and pretend you never drove up here. I’m taking care of the two hoodlums.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: You mean besides being a hot shot attorney you’re taking over my job too? What’s left for me then, Cameron?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I’m dug in here Bobby, go home, please!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: Put the gun do.... Cameron calmly fires. Eyes filled with disbelief, the She goes down: Almost simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: Cameron's head explodes into pieces. Blood, brains everywhere. Sarah screams. Billy dives to hold her. Earl lowers his rifle, takes off his sun glasses “Dirty Harry” style. He rushes to the Sheriff and examines the wound. Sheriff Robert slowly regains consciousness. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  98.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Ain’t that bad, boss. Ain’t bad at all. I’1l have an ambulance here in no time. (looks at Billy and Sarah) ) What do you want me to do with them two misfits? Sheriff Robert hesitates, then:

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: Let ‘em go Earl.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF ROBERT
dialogues.text: They’11 wind up behind bars or in the obituary page without us lifting a finger. Earl does his best version of a sombre thoughtful nod. He looks over at Billy and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Go on. You heard the Sheriff. Get movin’. With Sarah’s help, Billy pulls himself together. The two quietly exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: SHOWER HEAD, as water pours down on Sarah. Sarah emerges from the bathroom, wearing her summer dress towel wrapped around her head. Billy wakes up, rubs his e

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How're you feeling? You’ve been sleeping forever. Sarah moves over to the bed and sits next to Billy. He pe at the bandages covering his arm and his leg, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You did that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yep. He kisses her. Sarah responds tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’ll do for now. But you gotta see a doctor. Billy nods, looks around the room. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  99.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sure. You seen my jacket somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Its in car.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I got a surprise. I think you gonna like it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL, DAY
dialogues.text: Limping, Billy steps out of the motel room. He looks abou the parking lot. Except his convertible, there is no othe car in sight. Billy spots an ice cream machine close to t front office. He checks his change.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL, FRONT-OFFICE, DAY
dialogues.text: CU: LARGE BUTTON, being pushed. Seconds later, a wrapped cream bar spirals down the dispenser. Billy picks up the frozen treat, then slowly crosses towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL, PARKING-LOT, DAY
dialogues.text: CU: CAR-DOOR. Billy opens the door and grabs his jacket f the backseat. He checks the inside pocket, pulls out the envelope we saw earlier. CU: TRUNK-LOCK. Billy turns the key, opens the trunk lid. He reaches deep inside the trunk. Amidst the junk inside the broken flamingo sculpture from Niles basement. He sla the hood shut, carrying the weird looking flamingo. Nothi but the sound of traffic in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: The door is slightly ajar. Billy gives the door a gentle kick, it sways open. He steps inside. The room appears em

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey, remember at Stanleys, when I asked you about your favorite ice cream? Check this out... I brought along a keepsake from the plantation... He holds the ice cream bar, puts the flamingo down. There no answer. Something isn’t right. BILLY (CONT’D) Sarah? A gush of wind goes through the room. Curtains blow, door swing. A series of quick cuts follow: CU: SARAH’S REFLECTION in a mirror on the bathroom door. EDWARD'S large hand covers her mouth. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  100. WHIP-PAN TO CU: BILLY, as he spots Sarah’s reflection. He whirls his head back to the parking lot, staring at a car the far end of the parking-lot. It’s the CADILLAC. WHIP-PAN TO CU: A COCKED GUN, pushed into Billy's cheek. WIDE: THE SCENE UNFOLDS. Billy standing inside the room. Keeping Billy at gunpoint, Edward steps out of the corner the room, tossing Sarah onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Ice cream? What flavor? Edward takes the ice cream out of Billy’s hand, licks the bar. A split second later he pistol whips Billy. Billy fa onto the floor, as Edward slams the front-door close.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL, DAY
dialogues.text: Edward is not a pretty sight, but unmistakably he cleaned himself up since spending time inside the trunk of the Cadillac. His clothes are several sizes too big, obviousl stolen. His injured eye is hidden behind an eye patch. Hu up in the corner of the room, Billy is leaning on Sarah's shoulder. Edward pulls out a small plastic container, tea off the lid with his teeth and starts chewing away on sev pain killers.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I know... I look terrible. Had to borrow some clothes, and what not... but all things considered not a bad comeback, what do say, Sarah? I even found myself a nice 38 along the way...oh... one piece of advice: Billy, next time you’re on the run, don’t ever park a fucked up car like yours along a highway. Might as well put a balloon with a for sale sign on it. Edward pulls out a pint of liquor from his jacket, washes pills down. EDWARD (CONT’D) Tell me, Billy Boy. You got any money for me? Billy hesitates. He takes out the envelope from his jacke throws it on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Ten grand’s all I got out of that friggin’ lawyer. A grotesque grin comes across Edwards face. He quickly crosses the room, grabs Billy by his shirt and pulls him from Sarah. Edward sticks the barrel of the 38. into Bill mouth. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  101.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: How come I don’t believe you... you lying motherfucker? Edward cocks the gun. EDWARD (CONT’D) Where is the rest? Billy, shaking with fear, mutters something incomprehensi Edward slowly removes the pistol from Bills mouth, keeps barrel point at him.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You can turn the place upside down. That’s all there is, I swear. Edward steps back and sits down on the bed. He takes the envelope and start counting the bills.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Thief like you invests all that time baby sitting little Sarah and ten measly grand’s all you got to show for? Billy, that’s about five cents on every dollar you owe me. That’s not good. Not good at all.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Billy... what’s he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Go ahead, tell her. Billy stays silent while Edward keeps counting the dollar notes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You see Sarah, your boyfriend sold a half a kilo of my dope to pay his gambling debts. Turns out that Billy’s buyer just happens to be an acquaintance of mine... Get the picture? Well, me nice guy that I am, instead of chopping his good for nothing head off, I let him have a chance to redeem himself. All he had to do is give you a helping hand collecting your look-alike’s fortune. Sarah baby, you follow? You look confused. You were set up, you understand? Sarah stares at Billy in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I need a cigarette. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  102. Edward pulls out a pack of smokes and throws the cigarett toward Sarah. Close to a nervous breakdown, she lights up

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Take the money and let us go. Edward raises his voice.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Got yourself a little romance in the works, Billy? Can’t blame you, I took a joyride myself with that sweet pumpkin. And boy, does she have a surprise waitin’ and I ain’t talking about strawberry ice cream. Sorry folks, there ain’t gonna be no happy ending... ‘cause the both of you made one very bad mistake.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What’s that? Edward moves toward Billy and Sarah, clinches his fist.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: I got hurt real bad and I’m really... (searches for the word) ... pissed off. SUDDENLY, Edward is struck by a terrifying wave of rage. picks up the whiskey bottle and throws it against the wal The bottle smashes into pieces, the liquor drenches the carpet. He strikes Billy with his gun across the face. Bi cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stop it!! Sarah throws her arms up, attempting to hit Edward. The l cigarette goes up in the air, then hits the alcohol-drenc carpet. The carpet ignites. Edward punches her into the stomach. Sarah falls to the ground, groaning, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: You wanna to kill me, baby? Well, you don’t know what you’re doing. Forgot to make sure to kill me dead! Let me show you how its done... Edward points his gun at Billy. Billy’s eyes drift toward the flames. For a snip of a moment Edward turns around, s the blaze going up the wall behind him. Billy takes advantage, jumps up and tackles Edward. Viciously fightin both men fall onto the bed while the fire spreads around them. Sarah, coming to, looks on in horror. CU: GLASS TOP, NIGHT-STAND, as it crashes, leaving large pieces of glass spread about the carpet. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  103. Meanwhile, the fight continues. Despite his injuries Edwa appears to gain the upper hand as he slowly pushes the gu towards Billy's chest. Billy, helplessly, stares into Edward’s face. CU: EDWARD'S FACE, twitching with pleasure. Suddenly, he grimaces with pain. Sarah, a large piece of glass in both hands repeatedly thrusts the sharp object into Edward’s back. Finally, her stabbing-frenzy comes to an end, Edward stumbles backward As if that wasn’t “enough”, Sarah spots the flamingo with broken off leg, exposing a metal rood. She grabs the sculpture and plants the stake-like pole deep into Edward chest, leaving the flamingo standing tall. Sarah shouts:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dead enough for you, asshole? In the meantime, most of the room, including the money, i consumed by fire. Billy takes Sarah’s hand and pulls her the front door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOTEL, DAY
dialogues.text: The couple comes dashing out the room. A dark cloud of sm follows them. The twosome runs toward the convertible. Moments later the car takes off, leaving the burning mote and Edward behind.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HIGHWAY, YELLOW CONVERTIBLE, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Billy is at the wheel. Sarah peeks into the dark. Both lo pale and tired. A long silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So, was it all true, what he said? Billy stares into the night ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It was my only chance to get out. So, I went along. Sarah is almost amused by how disappointing it all is.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They must've had a school to train you to lie as much as you do.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you everything a million times. But I...I didn’t want to loose you... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  104.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somehow in my fucked-up head I kept thinking that once I found a way around the lawyer, we'd be set up for life, and how it started wouldn’t matter. It’s a bad gambler’s habit: You need a lucky streak so bad you get convinced it’s gotta come.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You really want me to believe that? Billy pulls over onto the shoulder of the highway. There silence as the engine idles calmly. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sarah, there is no excuse for what I did, But, if I would have known about... what he did to you, I would have killed that monster a long time ago. Sarah looks ahead with a strange calm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: --. he lied. Nothing happened. (beat) You’11 never know how sad it feels when a guy says just what you want to hear but none of it’s true. Every kiss, every look... nothing but a fairy-tale.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: But it was true. Sarah half-laughs, half cries at him saying that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How do you get off saying that?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I was in love with you from the first moment I walked into Stanley's. No matter what else I said, no matter what else I did, that was always true. It still is. Billy pulls out a rolled up canvas from the back seat and hand it to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Remember the painting?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The one above the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I want you to have it. Apparently it’s worth around a hundred K. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  105.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can start fresh, forget about me. I’m a bad seed, just like Eddie said. Sarah is exhausted, not sure of herself. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know what? Screw Eddie. Billy manages a smile, as the car disappears into the nig The End Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
